title: Introduction to Flask
content: Flask is a micro web framework for Python, known for its simplicity and flexibility. It is ideal for small to medium-sized web applications.
author: John Doe

title: Getting Started with MongoDB
content: MongoDB is a NoSQL database designed for scalability and flexibility. It stores data in JSON-like documents, making it easy to use for modern applications.
author: Jane Smith

title: Understanding REST APIs
content: A REST API is a way for two systems to communicate over HTTP. RESTful principles include stateless communication, a uniform interface, and resource representation.
author: Alice Johnson

title: Why Choose Python for Web Development?
content: Python offers extensive libraries, readability, and a vast community, making it a popular choice for web development. Frameworks like Flask and Django add to its appeal.
author: Bob Lee

title: An Introduction to NoSQL Databases
content: NoSQL databases like MongoDB offer flexibility and scalability by moving away from the traditional table-based relational databases. They are particularly useful for large datasets.
author: Chris Brown
